intro: Spiesia mertensiana, commonly known as the Mertens' spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features simple, alternate leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. It is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Euphorbiaceae family. Spiesia mertensiana is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
